intro: Reseda buhseana var. buhseana, commonly known as the Buhse's reseda, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs.
